title: Radiation Safety and Protection Protocols
description: Comprehensive safety protocols for radiation therapy departments

content.title: ALARA Principle
content.content: All radiation exposures should be kept As Low As Reasonably Achievable (ALARA), taking into account economic and social factors.

items: **Time:** Minimize exposure time
**Distance:** Maximize distance from radiation source
**Shielding:** Use appropriate protective barriers
**Training:** Ensure all personnel are properly trained
**Monitoring:** Continuous radiation monitoring programs
**Lead Aprons:** 0.25-0.5 mm Pb equivalent minimum
**Thyroid Shields:** 0.25 mm Pb equivalent minimum
**Lead Gloves:** For fluoroscopy and brachytherapy procedures
**Protective Eyewear:** 0.25 mm Pb equivalent for lens protection
**Mobile Shields:** Available for all treatment areas

content.content: All treatment rooms must have comprehensive safety systems to prevent accidental exposure to patients, staff, and the public.

content.title: Emergency Response
content.content: All staff must be trained in emergency procedures and know the location of emergency equipment and contacts.

items: **Patient Emergency:** Stop beam immediately, enter room, provide medical care
**Equipment Malfunction:** Follow lockout/tagout procedures, notify physicist
**Fire/Evacuation:** Secure radioactive sources, evacuate per facility protocol
**Radiation Exposure:** Document incident, notify radiation safety officer
**Source Loss:** Implement search procedures, notify regulatory authorities

content.content: HDR brachytherapy requires specialized safety protocols due to the high activity sources used.

items: **Patient Isolation:** Private room with radiation precautions
**Visitor Restrictions:** Limited time and distance requirements
**Nursing Care:** Minimize exposure time, maximize distance
**Waste Management:** Segregated disposal of contaminated materials
**Source Accountability:** Continuous monitoring of implanted sources
**Fixed Monitors:** Permanently installed in high-risk areas
**Portable Surveys:** Regular contamination and exposure surveys
**Leak Testing:** Semi-annual testing of sealed sources
**Air Sampling:** When airborne contamination is possible
**Bioassay:** For workers with internal contamination risk

content.content: Radiation therapy facilities must comply with federal, state, and local regulations governing the use of ionizing radiation.

content.title: Documentation Requirements
content.content: Maintain comprehensive records of all safety activities, training, incidents, and monitoring results for regulatory compliance.

items: **Initial Training:** Comprehensive radiation safety program for all new employees
**Annual Refresher:** Update on procedures, regulations, and incident reviews
**Specialized Training:** Role-specific training for different job categories
**Emergency Drills:** Regular practice of emergency procedures
**Competency Assessment:** Regular evaluation of safety knowledge and skills
